page.title: 04LOCAL EVENTS
page.content: Every year some taxi drivers from Edinburgh take handicapped children away for the day from their schools down to Yellowcraigs to a picnic. The taxis are all decorated with crepe paper, balloons and streamers. The one that was voted the best dressed taxi looked like the teddy bears picnic. It was a shame that it was raining because that might have been the only time that some of them could get to the beach. The children might have gone into Aberlady Hall. That is where they usually go when it is raining. On the way back all the balloons were blowing off the taxis. The taxis stop off for icecream in Musselburgh.
